name: detectedIssue
title: Clinical Issue
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG
description: A reference to a stored contraindication that is the basis for this issue. A recipient can expect that the item referenced in this extension is being retained for record keeping purposes.

element.short: Reference to a contra-indication that is the basis for this error
element.definition: A reference to a stored contraindication that is the basis for this issue. A recipient can expect that the item referenced in this extension is being retained for record keeping purposes.
element.comment: Operation Outcome records are transient items that are returned in response to specific interactions or operations. Contraindications are items that can be stored in the patient's records as reasons that things were not done (or done). This extension allows a transient operation outcome to refer to a persistent entry in the patient record as the basis for the outcome.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
